H0.text: Liverworts are most often found along stream beds.

H1.text: Liverworts are most often found in the ocean.

H2.text: On mountains, liverworts are most often found.

H3.text: In deserts, liverworts are most often found.

A4.text: Today, liverworts can be found in many ecosystems across the planet except the sea and excessively dry environments, or those exposed to high levels of direct solar radiation.

A5.text: They are most common in moist tropical areas.

A6.text: Bryophytes are characteristically limited in size and prefer moist habitats although some species can survive in drier environments.

A7.text: 400-year-old bryophyte specimens left behind by retreating glaciers in Canada are brought back to life in the laboratory.

A8.text: Regeneration of Little Ice Age bryophytes emerging from a polar glacier with implications of totipotency in extreme environments.

A9.text: Grasses and low shrubs are the dominant vegetation here and the ground may be covered with lichens.
